p: Flash point is the lowest temperature at which a liquid can form an ignitable mixture in air near the surface of the liquid. It has value of 290.00 (pulp) and 295.00 (seed) H. barteri oils. The lower the flash point, the easier it is to ignite the material. The extracted oils were light amber yellow and pale yellow colour for pulp and seed oils of H. barteri samples, respectively. The relative standard deviation (RSD) ranged from 0.00% in specific gravity to 18.52 in acid value.
